snippet: As opening day approaches, a former baseball reporter finds that his fondest memories are as much about the meals as the games.

headline.main: Touching All the Bases Outside the Ballpark
headline.print_headline: Touching All the Bases Outside the Ballpark

snippet: Rewarding manufacturers who increase their payroll in the United States may not be as effective as supporting the firms whose creations can conquer world markets — and pay for the jobs of the rest of us.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column on the seemingly promising upturn in American manufacturing suggests that it is innovation, not manufacturing, that has has always propelled American progress; calls for a jobs strategy that does not blunt the edge of competitive firms even if they outsource; concludes that a strategy to reward manufacturers who increase their payroll in the US may not be as effective as one to support the firms whose creations can conquer world markets.

headline.main: The Promise of Today’s Factory Jobs
headline.print_headline: The Promise Of Today’s Factory Jobs

snippet: In responding to Yahoo's original intellectual property lawsuit, Facebook argued that the Web pioneer had violated patents that cover some 80 percent of its revenues last year, amounting to more than $4 billion.
abstract: In responding to Yahoo's original intellectual property lawsuit, Facebook argued that the Web pioneer had violated patents that cover some 80 percent of its revenues last year, amounting to more than $4 billion.

headline.main: Facebook Accuses Yahoo of Infringing on Patents
headline.print_headline: Facebook Files Patent Infringement Lawsuit Against Yahoo

snippet: Discovery Bay Games, a maker of games and puzzles, has created an analog iPad add-on called Duo Pop that combines traditional board games with a touch-screen tablet.

snippet: The European Union's competition office opened two antitrust cases on Tuesday against Motorola Mobility for possible patent abuses after complaints by two rivals, Microsoft and Apple.
abstract: The European Union's competition office opened two antitrust cases on Tuesday against Motorola Mobility for possible patent abuses after complaints by two rivals, Microsoft and Apple.
